The claim was made in an advertisement f: Honey-C" that was published on Facebook on March 31, 2020. The advertisement featured a photo with red text that claimed the supplement was "FDA APPROVED".
The advertisement included a mix of Taga: stating that the supplement was effective "AGAINST CORONA VIRUS" and could boost the immune system.
Multiple identical advertisements making: indicating a coordinated effort to promote the supplement.
The expert: s verdict, based on information from the FDA and WHO, concluded that the claims made in the advertisements were false. The FDA Director General stated that "Honey-C" was unregistered and the advertisement was misleading. The FDA also issued an advisory warning against purchasing the supplement and emphasized that no effective treatment for COVID-19 has been approved.
